page.title: 09AYLMERTON CHURCH
page.content: Aylmerton church is a member of a group of parishes, which also includes West Runton and East Runton. It is one of only a few remaining {round-tower}churches in Norfolk. It has an arch-way leading into the tower, and part of the tower dates from 930 A.D. The church is very strategically positioned on top of a hill just north of the main settlement. It is not used as much as it was in earlier years, but is still involved in the community. {Services}are held every Sunday morning, and twice on the first Sunday of each month. Every year, there are about five weddings and about the same number of funerals. There are a few christenings, and these are held at the end of the services. {Volunteers}help maintain the church.
